location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'BUNDER ABBAS-PUHAL SURVEY Section No III Puhal', '(Sd.) B.W. MAINPRISE, Capt. R.E., Octr. 1913.'

mods.abstract: The map forms one of three map enclosures to a report written by Captain Bertie Wilmot Mainprise assessing whether a more suitable port than the existing one at Bandar Abbas could be created further to the west.The map shows the settlement of Puhal and environs on the southern coast of Persia, and indicates settlements, buildings, hydrology, vegetation, cultivation, relief with contours and spot heights, roads, paths, wells and reservoirs. The map also provides a key to symbols.A printing statement reads, 'S[imla].D[rawing].O[ffice]. No. 886 February, 1914.', and a hand-stamp on the verso reads, 'Received in Political Department 23 Mar 1914'.

name.namePart: Simla Drawing Office, General Staff, India
